page.title: 14FARMING, SOMERFORD AREA
page.content: Farming is the major activity in our area and Brook Farm in Great Somerford is a good example.It is very old and has been worked for about 900 years. The present owners have been there since 1947. There are 542 hectares of land but some of these are rented out to other people.Most of this is used for dairy farming but some is used for growing crops.At present there are 449 acres of wheat,98 acres of barley,37 acres of oil-seed rape and 12 acres of potatoes. As the local farms are situated close to a river,they have to be very careful not to allow toxic waste and silage to seep into the river.This pollution would kill the fish and the fine can be as much as Â£1000.
